intro: Fadogiella cana, commonly known as the pale fadogiella, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Fadogiella cana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
